title: Cannot connect tp IPv6 peers

labels.name: P4
labels.description: Low (ex: Node doesn't start up when the configuration file has unexpected "end-of-line" character)

labels.name: TeamRevenant

body:
While running Yolov2 in a docker container I saw this error complaining about ipv6 addresses.  Not sure if it's a Besu bug or a docker limitation.  Note the IPv6 address in the enode.

### Additional Information
This causes fast sync to hang when I try syncing for the first time in a docker image on the `ropsten` chain. IPv6 peers are pretty common too so it's really hard to get a node syncing as a result.
assigning this one to you too @frankisawesome - think this should be cleared up by your changes

So this is a docker config issue - docker doesn't have ipv6 enabled by default.
There will be three steps to this:
1. https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/pull/2970 hide full stacktrace to TRACE level
2. Update troubleshooting section in besu-docs
3. Potentially update the quickstart guides in besu-docs with instructions to enable ipv6
